title: The Rationality of Emotion
relevance: Emotions guide attention and reasoning non-propositionally; foundation for non-binary, gradient model of EI

title: The Emotions
relevance: Emotions directed at objects and values beyond bodily states; supports separate 'Sense' and 'Explain' axes

title: MSCEIT
relevance: Splits EI into perceive, use, understand and regulate; validated on large sample guiding multi-score approach

title: How Emotions Are Made
relevance: Emotions depend on context, concepts and culture; informs Adapt axis and dataset design

title: EmpatheticDialogues
relevance: Dialogue dataset providing gold empathic responses; baseline for Respond axis

title: Upheavals of Thought
relevance: Seminal cognitive account of emotions as evaluative judgments

title: Descartes' Error
relevance: Influential exploration of interrelation between emotion and cognition

title: Gut Reactions
relevance: Contemporary philosophical defense of perceptual and bodily approaches

title: On the Morality of Artificial Agents
relevance: Seminal paper on attributing moral agency to AI systems

title: Atlas of AI
relevance: Analyzes power and inequity in AI systems

title: Antecedent- and Response-focused Emotion Regulation
relevance: Foundational paper on emotion regulation processes

title: Does the autistic child have a 'theory of mind'?
Emotion Recognition in Conversation
relevance: Benchmark for multimodal emotion recognition models

title: The Extended Mind
relevance: Seminal work on cognition extending into the environment

title: Phenomenology of Perception
relevance: Classic account of embodied perception and lived experience

title: A Survey on Bias and Fairness in Machine Learning
relevance: Comprehensive review of bias and fairness metrics in ML
